results.title: Just like dad
results.brief_description: Gemma’s dad, an old rocker from way back, is passionate about music and anything and everything that is remotely connected to music. This addiction comes to a head when dad discovers Ebay on the home computer. Searches and purchases; Ebay has taken over his life. Worse still, Ebay the enemy is now growing on Gemma. She is her father’s daughter! Uses stills and animation.

group.title: Western stories: expressions for the future. [Vol. 1]

results.title: Just hold still. Parts one and two
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and colour and audio
results.brief_description: In his New York City Landscape, Cohen finds inspiration in disturbance. Looking to life for rhythm and to architecture for state of mind, he locates simple mysteries. `Just Hold Still’ is comprised of an interconnected series of short works and collaborations that explore the grey area between documentary, narrative and experimental genres. Part One concerns a personal, poetic approach to narrative while Part Two involves hybridized use of verite footage and the confrontation of documentary concerns with the music video format. The work can be considered as a whole or each piece in the project can be viewed (and rented) as a separate entity.

results.title: Just for me
results.creator_credit: Dee Simpson, ONF | NFB and Lois Tupper
results.brief_description: Just for Me documents three women’s experiences with fitness and sport: that of a homemaker with children, an office worker who has just moved to the city, and a married school teacher. The film looks at the women before they participate in a sport, as well as during and after the experience.

results.title: Just For Fun
results.creator_credit: Brighton Grammar School (Vic.). Film Makers Club and Raymond Moon
results.brief_description:
On the way to his club house, a boy finds a wallet in the street. When members of the club go to Luna Park to return the wallet to its owner, who works there, a loutish pair gain possession of it. They spend freely from the wallet while club members led by their president, search for them. Finally they are caught, and members of the club are rewarded for their perseverance.

Story by Greg Laxon.
Cast: D. Siminton, H. Fraser, I. Couch, J. Chambers, D. Pepper, T. Foster, C. Capper, L. Macartney, and M. Rozen.
(Awards: 2nd prize, International Film Contest for Young Film Makers, Milan Italy)

results.title: Just for dad
results.brief_description: My Dad means a lot to me. He works in Western Australia now, so I don’t get to see him as much as I used to. This story is a tribute to my Dad.

results.title: Just do it
results.creator_credit: La Verite Films, Kim Snow, Jenny Livingston and Sarah Hatherley
results.brief_description: Two thirty-something women, Alice, an aspiring filmmaker, and Sandy, a student with a messy love life, meet regularly to walk around the domain. As they walk they talk about the state of their lives, yet, due especially to Sandy’s self-obsession and insensitivity, their conversations are less dialogues than therapeutic monologues. The tables are turned when Sandy’s unsympathetic response to her friend’s creative struggles, and her dismissive remark to ‘just do it’ have an unexpected outcome. Cast: Alison Whyte, Alice Garner.

results.title: Just desserts
results.creator_credit: Monica Pellizzari and NRG Films Australia
results.brief_description: This delicious comedy about an Italo-Australian girl’s sexual awakening and her love for her mama’s cooking is written, produced and directed by Monica Pellizzari. Through the use of a split screen which separates the food from the experience, issues such as menstruation, masturbation, lesbianism and virginity are explored, against a backdrop of broth, venetian fritters, polenta, dumplings and pizza. Cast includes Dina Panozzo and Anne-Louise Lambert.

results.title: Just desserts
results.brief_description: This wonderfully sensuous short presents the rites of puberty as a menu of Italian favourites: a young girls first period occurs when she is stomping the grapes; gnocchi is forever to remind her of first having sex with a boy; burnt polenta is the taste of lesbian longing. A lovely remembrance of an Italo-Australian adolescence.

results.title: Just call me Kade [NTSC]
results.brief_description: This documentary focuses on Kade Farlow Collins a teenage FTM (female to male transgendered person) residing in Tucson, Arizona. At the age of fourteen Kade (then Kate), supported by her family, began the process of transitioning from female to male. Drawing on his personal narrative the film follows Kade’s transition over a two year period. Friends and family candidly express their feelings about the transition, the changes in Kade and the impact on everyone involved. A moving story of some of the difficulties facing transgendered youth, as well as a portrayal of acceptance and understanding.

results.title: Just business
results.brief_description:
A drama of revenge and retribution demonstrating high production values to create a corporate world of greed and indifference. Controlled camera work, lighting and slick editing combine with assured direction of the actors to create tension as this disturbing tale reaches its climax.
WARNING: THIS FILM CONTAINS SCENES THAT MAY DISTURB SOME VIEWERS
